item.title: 我最喜爱的谋杀案》新协议对播客市场的启示
item.description:
另外： 未来一年的音乐、播客和有声读物预测

。【原文：

Plus: music, podcasting and audiobook predictions for the year ahead

】

item.title: 美国商品期货交易委员会（CFTC）面临没钱支付举报人分红的风险
item.description: 美国衍生品市场监管部门在打击被指控的欺诈者和市场操纵者的一年中创下了 171 亿美元的记录，但现在它可能成为自己成功的受害者，因为它希望奖励那些帮助过它的人。【原文：The US derivatives market watchdog had a record $17.1 billion year cracking down on alleged fraudsters and market manipulators but could now become a victim of its own success as it looks to reward those who helped.】

item.title: 美联储调低降息预期后，债券大跌
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）对2025年降息持更为谨慎的态度，令投资者大跌眼镜，并导致全球债券市场溃败，市政债券的跌幅是几周来最大的。【原文：Municipal bonds are plunging the most in weeks after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell took a more cautious view on interest-rate cuts in 2025, stunning investors and leading to a global bond-market rout.】

item.title: 当 TikTok 穷途末路时，这位亿万富翁提出了拯救计划
item.description: 尽管 TikTok 在美国面临着迫在眉睫的禁令，但中国母公司字节跳动有限公司（ByteDance Ltd. ）已明确表示，它不打算出售这款流行的视频应用程序。弗兰克-麦考特似乎并没有被吓倒。【原文：Even as TikTok faces a looming ban in the US, Chinese parent company ByteDance Ltd. has made it clear it has no plans to sell the popular video app. Frank McCourt doesn’t seem deterred.】

item.title: 移民推动美国人口实现二十年来最快增长
item.description: 美国人口普查局的数据显示，移民人数的激增是自 2001 年以来美国人口增幅最大的一年。【原文：A surge in immigration drove the largest annual increase to the US population since 2001, according to the Census Bureau.】

item.title: 美联储之后华尔街的下一个考验：6.5 万亿美元的 "三重魔咒
item.description: 随着华尔街交易员逐渐接受美联储放缓降息步伐的计划，周五的美国期权到期日为年末的平静扫清了最后一道障碍。【原文：As Wall Street traders come to grips with the Federal Reserve’s plans to slow the pace of interest-rate cuts, Friday’s US options expiration that has historically stoked turbulence offers a final hurdle to end-of-year calm.】

item.title: 墨西哥连续第四次降息，通胀放缓
item.description: 墨西哥周四连续第四次降息，原因是通胀正在放缓，回到目标水平，经济正在失去动力。【原文：Mexico cut interest rates for a fourth straight meeting Thursday as inflation is slowing back to target and the economy is losing momentum.】

item.title: 英特尔入围可编程芯片 Arm Altera 竞争者名单
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，英特尔公司（Intel Corp. ）已经为其 Altera 部门的下一轮竞购筛选了多家收购公司，这家陷入困境的芯片制造商正在为其现已下台的首席执行官启动的竞购进程取得进展。【原文：Intel Corp. has shortlisted a number of buyout firms for the next round of bidding for its Altera unit, according to people familiar with the matter, as the beleaguered chipmaker makes headway on a process started by its now ousted chief executive officer.】

item.title: 巴西央行驳斥对货币政策威力的质疑
item.description: 巴西央行行长表示，他们拥有所有必要的工具来抑制拉丁美洲最大经济体的通胀回升。【原文：Brazil central bankers said they have all the tools needed to tame an inflation pick-up in Latin America’s largest economy that’s driving analysts to question how effective their monetary policy really is.】

item.title: 特朗普的加密项目购买与孙正义有关的代币
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普的加密货币平台 World Liberty Financial 似乎通过 Coinbase Global Inc.【原文：Donald Trump’s crypto platform, World Liberty Financial, appears to have exchanged roughly $10 million of what’s known as wrapped Bitcoin launched through Coinbase Global Inc. for similar tokens associated with project adviser Justin Sun.】

item.title: 英国央行调查显示：包装规则可能推高通胀率
item.description: 英格兰银行的一项调查发现，即将出台的回收法规将使一些公司付出与工党提高工资税同样高的代价，并可能导致价格上涨。【原文：A Bank of England survey found that upcoming recycling regulations will cost some companies as much as Labour’s payroll tax hike and could result in higher prices.】

item.title: 美联储利率 "盲驾"，股市多头无舵可航
item.description: 在美联储的鹰派立场引发历史性溃败不到 24 小时后，牛市在周四交易开始时冲进股市，抢购突然发售的股票。【原文：Bulls stormed into the stock market at the start of trading Thursday, snapping up shares suddenly on sale less than 24 hours after the Federal Reserve’s hawkish pivot sparked a historic rout.】

item.title: 墨西哥提高关税高达 35% 以支持纺织业就业
item.description: 墨西哥经济部长表示，墨西哥已对可能影响其国内纺织业的产品加征高达 35% 的关税。【原文：Mexico has increased tariffs by as much as 35% on products that could impact its domestic textile industry, the Economy Minister said.】

item.title: 穆迪做出关键调整后，混合债券在美国炙手可热
item.description: 当 CVS Health Corp. 在 12 月初出售 30 亿美元债券时，它依靠的是一种不同寻常的债务，这种债务今年的发行量创下了历史新高，并可能在 2025 年创下新高。【原文：When CVS Health Corp. sold $3 billion of bonds in early December, it relied on an unusual kind of debt that saw record issuance this year and could set a new high in 2025.】

item.title: 亚马逊被卡车司机工会盯上，试图扰乱圣诞节
item.description: 在亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）的劳工活动多年来一直不温不火之后，国际卡车司机兄弟会（International Brotherhood of Teamsters）采取了一种更直接的策略：呼吁在圣诞节前六天举行全国性罢工。【原文：After years of hit-and-miss labor activism at Amazon.com Inc., the International Brotherhood of Teamsters has adopted a more direct tactic: calling for a nationwide strike six days before Christmas.】

item.title: 意大利就 34 亿欧元资产出售中的税收问题对长江和记黄埔进行调查
item.description: 长江和记控股有限公司（CK Hutchison Holdings Ltd.）的意大利电信部门成为调查对象，指控其在向 Cellnex Telecom SA 出售 34 亿欧元（36 亿美元）资产时逃税。【原文：CK Hutchison Holdings Ltd.’s Italian telecommunications unit is the target of a probe alleging that it evaded taxes during a €3.4 billion ($3.6 billion) asset sale to Cellnex Telecom SA.】

item.title: 农业不景气拖入 2025 年，拖累机械制造商爱科公司
item.description: 农业机械生产商爱科公司（AGCO Corp.【原文：Shares of agriculture machinery maker AGCO Corp. fell the most in more than a month as the agriculture machinery maker said it will be pressured next year as farmers keep struggling with low crop prices.】

item.title: 英国央行不会因数据 "噪音 "而放弃宽松政策
item.description: 在英国过去两年的大部分通胀冲击中，英格兰银行的政策都是对工资和物价数据的波动做出反应。现在，英国央行更加重视自己的预测。【原文：For most of the UK’s inflation shock over the past two years, Bank of England policy reacted to swings in wage and prices data. Now it’s leaning much more prominently on its own forecasts.】

item.title: 富国银行招聘利联医疗保健银行家 Michael Giaquinto
item.description: 据一位知情人士透露，富国银行（Wells Fargo & Co.【原文：Wells Fargo & Co. has hired health-care banker Michael Giaquinto as a managing director focused on the medical technology sector from Leerink Partners, according to a person briefed on the matter.】

item.title: 即将实施的欧盟船舶气候规则将增加燃料支出
item.description: 欧盟一项旨在减少航运业温室气体排放的规定即将开始增加航运业的燃料开支。【原文：A European Union rule designed to cut greenhouse gas emissions from shipping is about to start adding to the industry’s fuel bills.】

item.title: Canal+ 伦敦首演后股价下挫，瑞银称定价合理
item.description: 在瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）称 Canal+ 的股票估值合理后，Canal+ 的股价大跌，与分析师预测这家法国电视公司本周在伦敦上市后将上涨的趋势背道而驰。【原文：Canal+ shares plummeted after UBS Group AG said the stock was fairly valued, bucking the trend of analysts predicting gains following the French television company’s debut in London this week.】

item.title: 2025 年写字楼有望反弹，而其他房地产股票将面临困境
item.description: 自 2022 年美联储开始加息以来，借贷成本飙升，房地产市场崩溃，这几年对房地产股票来说是充满挑战的几年。尽管 2024 年中期出现了健康反弹，但 2025 年的前景并不特别令人鼓舞。【原文：It’s been a challenging couple of years for real estate stocks since the Federal Reserve started raising interest rates in 2022, as borrowing costs soared and the property market collapsed. And despite a healthy rebound in the middle of 2024, the outlook for 2025 isn’t particularly encouraging.】

item.title: 西班牙议会投票取消能源企业暴利税
item.description: 西班牙议会废除了备受争议的能源公司国内收入暴利税，首相佩德罗-桑切斯（Pedro Sanchez）因此受挫。【原文：Spain’s controversial windfall tax on energy companies’ domestic revenue was scrapped in parliament in a setback for Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez.】

item.title: 现在买入的问题
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 央行称法国银行在预算危机中表现坚挺
item.description: 法兰西银行表示，法国大型银行对国家主权债务的风险敞口有限，这有助于它们在预算危机引发动荡时保持韧性。【原文：The large French banks have limited exposure to the country’s sovereign debt, the Banque de France said, contributing to their resilience as a budget crisis fuels turmoil.】

item.title: 央行开启了无法完成的利率下行之路
item.description:
美联储对减产的冷淡态度表明，世界正从顶峰回落，但不断变化的地形也同样危险。【原文：

The Fed’s cold feet on cuts shows that the world is down from a peak, but the changing terrain is no less dangerous.

】

item.title: 新任财政部长称加拿大有财政空间抵御关税战
item.description: 加拿大新任财政部长表示，如果唐纳德-特朗普的关税威胁演变成经济冲击，政府需要保持财政能力，为家庭和企业提供支持。【原文：Canada’s new finance minister said the government needs to preserve its fiscal ability to support households and businesses if Donald Trump’s tariff threats materialize into an economic shock.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）与阿根廷就贷款问题进行谈判，以完成 440 亿美元的协议
item.description: 阿根廷正在寻求与国际货币基金组织（IMF）达成一项新计划，以接替其目前的 440 亿美元协议，这是在解决华盛顿贷款机构最棘手的协议之一方面迈出的一步。【原文：Argentina is seeking a new program with the International Monetary Fund to succeed its current $44 billion deal, a step forward in resolving one of the Washington lender’s most problematic agreements.】

item.title: 英国央行行长贝利支持市场密切关注下一次利率决定
item.description: 英格兰银行行长安德鲁-贝利（Andrew Bailey）表示，市场押注英格兰银行的下一次利率决定将 "岌岌可危"，这是一个 "合理的起点"。【原文：Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey said market bets putting its next interest-rate decision on a knife-edge are a “reasonable starting point.”】

item.title: 意大利历史最悠久的足球俱乐部究竟归谁所有引发争论
item.description: 罗马尼亚投资者 Dan Sucu 实现了许多人梦寐以求的愿望：拥有一支历史悠久的意大利足球队。【原文：Romanian investor Dan Sucu realized what is, for many, a dream come true: owning a historic Italian football team.】
